books.title: Visual Thinking: The Hidden Gifts of People Who Think in Pictures, Patterns, and Abstractions
books.author: Temple Grandin
books.summary: In Visual Thinking, Temple Grandin explores how visual thinkers can contribute to creativity, problem solving, and innovation. She advocates for a more inclusive society that values different ways of thinking.

books.title: All About Love, New Visions
books.author: Bell Hooks
books.summary: All About Love by bell hooks examines the transformative power of love, advocating for a more inclusive, self-affirming approach that challenges societal norms and promotes healing, compassion, and connection.

books.title: Dare to Lead
books.author: Bren√© Brown
books.summary: This book was a gift from the Columbia Women's Basketball Head Coach, Megan Griffith. Brown explores how vulnerability plays a role in our lives and provides tools for embracing it in leadership roles.

books.title: Freedom is a Constant Struggle
books.author: Angela Y Davis
books.summary: Angela Davis discusses the impact intersectionality through social justice movements.

books.title: The Rise Of Superman, Decoding The Science Of Ultimate Human Performance
books.author: Steven Kotler
books.summary: The Rise of Superman explores the science behind extreme human performance, delving into how athletes enter 'flow' states to achieve seemingly impossible feats. The book highlights how this understanding can be applied to various fields to enhance performance.

books.title: Legacy, What The All Blacks Can Teach Us About The Business Of Life
books.author: James Kerr
books.summary: Legacy examines the leadership principles and values that have helped the All Blacks rugby team maintain excellence, offering insights into building strong teams and fostering a winning culture in any context.

books.title: Atomic Habits
books.author: James Clear
books.summary: Atomic Habits focuses on the power of small, incremental changes in daily habits, showing how these tiny adjustments can lead to significant long-term improvements in behavior and success.

books.title: Above The Line
books.author: Urban Meyer
books.summary: Above the Line by Urban Meyer outlines the principles of leadership and character development, emphasizing how individuals and teams can thrive by operating with a mindset that prioritizes discipline, accountability, and a strong work ethic.

books.title: On Civil Disobedience
books.author: Henry David Thoreau and Hanna Arendt
books.summary: On Civil Disobedience explores the moral justification for refusing to comply with laws that are seen as unjust, advocating for nonviolent resistance as a form of protest against social and political systems.

books.title: Range, Why Generalists Triumph In a Specialized World
books.author: David Epstein
books.summary: Range argues that generalists, rather than specialists, often succeed in a rapidly changing world by drawing from a wide variety of experiences and approaches, fostering creativity and adaptability.
